image.altText: an aboriginal man wearing a blue and yellow shirt waits to see a doctor in a clinic

props.synopsis: First Nations people living in the remote Northern Territory are still not expected to reach their 70th birthday. A rare visit inside one of the NT's oldest bush clinics demonstrates why.

title.children: The unlikely killers near Australia's most dangerous river crossing

image.altText: A man and a woman inside a camper van.

props.synopsis: Twenty-four years ago, the murder of British backpacker Peter Falconio sent shockwaves through Central Australia. The ambush left locals wondering "how something so evil could happen" on their doorstep, and it's a mystery that still haunts the community today.

title.children: How Murdoch's ambush of two backpackers 'changed the psyche' of outback Aussies

image.altText: Three for sale signs on a cul-de-sac in Darwin.

props.synopsis: Interstate investors are targeting homes across the Northern Territory and buying them up hours before they hit the market, as recent data shows Darwin has the tightest rental market in the country.

title.children: Interstate investors swarm NT homes, shutting out locals and raising rents

image.altText: Young Tigers supporter watches the action from fence during Tiwi Islands grand final day

props.synopsis: Thousands of people flocked to the Tiwi Islands over the weekend to cheer on local teams at the islands' biggest event of the year, the revered annual footy grand final.

title.children: Footy, art and culture draw big crowds to Tiwi Islands on grand final day

image.altText: An aerial photograph of Groote Eylandt

props.synopsis: An 18-year-old woman has been flown to hospital in Darwin after being allegedly speared in the head by a man known to her in a remote Northern Territory community.

title.children: Woman speared in head in alleged domestic violence attack

image.altText: Emergency hospital sing with hospital building in background

props.synopsis: A falling palm tree has struck and killed a four-year-old girl playing in a Darwin backyard, in what's been described as "a freak" accident.

title.children: Falling palm tree kills four-year-old girl in 'freak' accident

image.altText: A close-up of an Indigenous ranger looking through binoculars.

props.synopsis: Foreign fishers illegally entering Australian waters have been caught in their dozens in the Top End in the past 12 months, marking a concerning spike for rangers.

title.children: In Australia's north, rangers are battling a 'matter of national security'

image.altText: Charlie Ford, as a young girl, holds a large, fluffy cat with bright blue eyes.

props.synopsis: School bullying reaches devastating new peaks in Australia with figures showing a rising number of children as young as 10 expressing serious emotional distress following online and in-person abuse.

title.children: 'These kids don't seem to have any fear': Bullying rates peak in Australia

image.altText: A 70-year-old woman with shoulder length brown hair sitting down.

props.synopsis: The teenager pleaded guilty on Tuesday to several charges, including murder, in front of Vyleen White's husband and other family members.

title.children: Teenager pleads guilty to murder of Vyleen White

image.altText: A man smiles in a photo with coworkers

props.synopsis: Lawyers for alleged childcare paedophile Joshua Dale Brown expect he will face additional charges.

title.children: Accused Melbourne childcare sex offender likely to face more charges

image.altText: A dead fish with a fly on it on the sand

props.synopsis: The federal government has pledged $14 million to assist South Australia as it grapples with a toxic algal bloom outbreak, but just how far will that funding go and where should it be allocated? That depends on who you ask.

title.children: 'A drop in the ocean': Where should the funding to deal with the algal bloom be spent?

image.altText: Penny Wong sitting at a table at a diplomatic summit.

props.synopsis: The joint statement issued by the signatory countries criticises what they call the "inhumane killing" of Palestinians and condemns the "drip feeding of aid".

title.children: Australia among 28 nations calling for immediate end to war in Gaza

image.altText: An aerial view of a group of islands covered in trees and surrounded by reefs and turquoise and dark blue water.

props.synopsis: The United States would send "third country nationals" to the tiny Pacific Island nation of Palau, under a new proposed deal with the Trump administration.

title.children: US looks to send 'third country nationals' to Australia's Pacific neighbour

image.altText: A silver coin with the letter T in the centre and the words "USDT. Digital money for a digital age" around the circumference.

props.synopsis: There's a lot of money in crypto, but who are the winners in Trump's latest adventure?

title.children: Will Trump's GENIUS bill pay off?

image.altText: A man in a suit points at the camera

props.synopsis: The man who spearheaded negotiations on a global minimum tax rate says Australia could miss out on significant revenue from US multinational companies after the G7 "caved" to Donald Trump.

title.children: 'Free pass to dodge taxes': Critics slam US exemption from global tax floor

image.altText: dark clouds hover over Iluka Break Wall on beach street at iluka at new south wales

props.synopsis: The wait for significant drought relief is finally over, and for once the best falls will reach all the right places.

title.children: Heaviest rain and snow in years ahead for southern Australia

image.altText: Stocks displayed on a screen at the ASX

props.synopsis: The ASX is benefiting from a bounce in mining stocks and Wall Street hitting a fresh record close. Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

title.children: Miners lead ASX higher, Insignia jumps after takeover

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: ASX flat as miners gain and banks slump
RBA Board members note that RBA decisions that buck market expectations are not unprecedented
Iron ore prices at 3-month high, but is the rally sustainable?

image.altText: Man in uniform shining spotlight on water

props.synopsis: The search for a crocodile reportedly seen by a fisherman in the Noosa River continues, but authorities say there have been no additional sightings.

title.children: Rangers search for Noosa crocodile after potential sighting

image.altText: Night scene of a burnt out car in bush, two men bent over, a bright light illuminating the area.

props.synopsis: Three men are counting the cost of an unexplained fire that destroyed their four-wheel-drive vehicles and thousands of dollars in camping gear.

title.children: Three best mates were on a camping trip when everything went up in flames

image.altText: Prabha Kumar, smiling at the camera in a bright pink and gold traditional outfit.

props.synopsis: Indian national Prabha Arun Kumar was stabbed in the neck multiple times by a person dressed in black while walking home alone through Parramatta.

title.children: Sydney mother stabbed to death in 'targeted killing', coroner finds

image.altText: Three tents sit side by side under a tree in a park.

props.synopsis: Homelessness has risen to the "worst levels in living memory" in the first term of the Albanese government, advocacy groups warn, as the government grapples with advice that housing targets will not be met.

title.children: Women 'stuck' in refuges as housing crisis fuels worst homelessness 'in living memory'

image.altText: A woman is seen from above sitting on red carpet and working on a laptop

props.synopsis: A new peer-reviewed study finds a four-day work week improves both physical and mental health, reduces burnout and boosts job satisfaction. It's led some experts to say the federal government's productivity round table in August could help reframe work from being focused on hours to outcomes.

title.children: Working a four-day week without taking a pay cut improves health

image.altText: Police officer leaning on car, man blurred with arms crossed in blue shirt, rural background

props.synopsis: A Central Queensland man has been charged with deprivation of liberty and weapons offences for allegedly duct-taping two children and pointing a gun at them.

title.children: Man charged over alleged image of gun pointed at duct-taped kids

image.altText: A younger woman's hand holding an elderly patient's hand.

props.synopsis: Dozens of aged care residents are dying of COVID each week as facilities grapple with more than 240 outbreaks nationwide.

title.children: Hundreds of aged care facilities battle COVID outbreaks across Australia

image.altText: A drone photo taken from above a beach wall at Frankston South

props.synopsis: As sea level rises threaten coastal infrastructure, erosion is becoming a growing threat for communities across Australia.

title.children: Building individual seawalls 'doubles the erosion next door', experts say

image.altText: Breonna Taylor smiles in a uniform holding a certificate and flowers.

props.synopsis: A US judge sentences ex-Kentucky police officer Brett Hankison to prison for using excessive force, declining a Justice Department recommendation that he be given no prison time.

title.children: Judge rejects one-day sentence in Breonna Taylor case, sends ex-officer to prison

image.altText: A young man with shoulder-length blond hair wearing a shirt and jacket sits with his arms folded

props.synopsis: Dominic Amerena takes on the literary-industrial complex in his satirical debut offering set in Melbourne's western suburbs, I Want Everything.

title.children: Famous Aussie literary hoax inspires Melbourne author's debut novel

image.altText: People in various uniforms cluster around a damaged, burnt building.

props.synopsis: At least 19 people are killed and 171 students injued when a Bangladesh Air Force training jet crashes into a school and college campus in Dhaka.

title.children: Frantic parents search for children after Bangladesh jet crash kills 19

image.altText: A female with brown hair looks down at a wire with a branch wrapped around it.

props.synopsis: Ballooning water prices in Australia's largest wine grape growing region are pushing farmers to the brink amid a global oversupply of some wines and ongoing drought in southern Australia.

title.children: 'We're at breaking point': Drought and soaring water prices push wine grape growers to exit

image.altText: close-up of an aboriginal patient having his heart checked

props.synopsis: First Nations people living in the remote Northern Territory are still not expected to reach their 70th birthday. A rare visit inside one of the NT's oldest bush clinics demonstrates why.

title.children: The unlikely killers near Australia's most dangerous river crossing

image.altText: Elderly man with green striped shirt in front of a road

props.synopsis: Graham Chitty says breaking devastating news to the families of fatal car crash victims was the hardest part of his former policing job in regional WA, where he launched a confronting road safety program.

title.children: Police officer arrived at surprise 18th party to reveal girl killed in crash

image.altText: A young boy and a woman stand side by side in a pose for the camera.

props.synopsis: The Queensland government has announced the state's largest-ever investment in special schools, with a "clear demand for the schools".

title.children: Jasmin says she felt pressured to enrol her son at a special school

image.altText: David Warner and Steve Smith sit with cooling towels around them

props.synopsis: Cricket greats speak out after a new report warns increasing temperatures are making it harder to play the sport at all levels.

title.children: Alarming climate data shows 'existential threat' facing cricket

image.altText: Tadej Pogačar rides up a mountain in the yellow jersey

props.synopsis: The ascent to hell on the punishing slopes of Mont Ventoux is one of the Tour de France's most formidable and iconic theatres and has a history dotted with drama and tragedy.

title.children: The path to hell is up, not down, on this Tour de France climb with a deadly history
